cctair

Class Aircraft

  • java.lang.Object
    • cctair.Aircraft
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Airplane

    public class Aircraft
extends java.lang.Object
    An Aircraft object stores characteristics commonly shared by any type of aircraft.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Aircraft(int capacity, Pilot pilot, java.lang.String aircraftType)
      Constructor for the Aircraft object receiving its capacity, its aircraft type and an object of type Pilot.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aircraft

        public Aircraft(int capacity,
                Pilot pilot,
                java.lang.String aircraftType)
        Constructor for the Aircraft object receiving its capacity, its aircraft type and an object of type Pilot.
        Parameters:
        capacity - holds the maximum number of passengers of the instance of the Aircraft object.
        pilot - holds an object Pilot which is assigned to the instance of the Aircraft object.
        aircraftType - holds a String with the type of the aircraft.

    • Method Detail

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Capacity getter
        Returns:
        the capacity of the instance of the Aircraft object.

      • getAircraftType

        public java.lang.String getAircraftType()
        Aircraft type getter
        Returns:
        the aircraft type of the instance of the Aircraft object.

      • getPilotName

        public java.lang.String getPilotName()
        Pilot name getter
        Returns:
        name of pilot assigned to the instance of the Aircraft object.

      • assignPilot

        public void assignPilot(Pilot pilot)
        Assigns a pilot to the aircraft
        Parameters:
        pilot - of type Pilot is received from the method call and then assigned to the instance of the Aircraft object.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Aircraft information printer
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String with the aircraft type, its capacity and the assigned pilot's name.
